result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew R. Ammon

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 8:43am 
Defendant Andrew R. Ammon in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Andrew R. Ammon.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Mr. Ammon waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Defense stands mute, pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 
recess: 8:48am  

NEXT:   Plea and Sentencing on 12/1/22 at 2:30pm

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:10 AM.  Clerk - CRHI. (Calendar scheduled Adj. Plea Hrg; should have been a PH)
Defendant Andrew R. Ammon in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Andrew R. Ammon.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews case history, status and filings. 
State indicates that witnesses were not arranged because the matter was mis-calendared as an Adj. Plea Hearing rather than a Adj. Prelim. Hearing. 
Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Case continued for:
PTC - 9/28/22 at 2:40pm
PH - 10/4/22 at 8:30am.  (Defense to inform the State if matter is to be a waiver.)
Victim rights compliance verified by the Court. 
Recess 9:15am

Next - (Notices to be mailed.)
PTC - 9/28/22 at 2:40pm
PH - 10/4/22 at 8:30am.  (Defense to inform the State if matter is to be a waiver.)

Adjustment Number: 22A 185132,
Payable Number: 194196,
Receipt Number: 22R 014384,
Amount: $20.00

Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned plea hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 2:01pm 
Defendant Andrew R. Ammon appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Justin Singleton. 
Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Singleton agrees that the the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Ammon indicates that the Defendant's date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--not to make any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1 as referred to in the Criminal Complaint and the Victim Witness Key
recess 2:10pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on August 24th at 11:00am-only counsel need to appear,  (2) Preliminary Hearing on September 1st at 9:00am
